intro: Gratiola rigida, commonly known as rigid yellowroot, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow, umbellate flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are tuberous and have a yellowish-brown color, and they are often harvested for their medicinal properties. Gratiola rigida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded woodland habitats.
